How to help you Log on to your Locked Windows 7 System

How could you regain access to your computer when you forget the password? If you remember the password, you could create a Windows 7 password reset disk through Windows 7?s control panel in advance. And if you forgot Windows 7 password and was unable to log on to your computer, then you could use the disk to reset Windows 7 password.You can recover Windows 7 password easily and quickly by taking use of the Windows Login Recovery which enables you get Windows 7 password recovery instantly without any data losing or file damaging to the information preserved in your computer.Following is the brief tutorial of this utility.1. Download Windows Login Recovery to install it on an accessible computer.2. Running the program and insert a CD/DVD or USB drive into computer.3. Create a [b]Windows 7 password reset CD/DVD or USB drive.4. Insert the CD/DVD or USB drive into your locked computer.5. Set BIOS of the locked PC to boot from CD/DVD or USB drive if your computer failed to boot from it.6. All the user names will be displayed before you, and you can select one to remove its password.7. Remove the burned CD/DVD or USB drive from computer, restart your computer.8. Now you regain access to your system.With any of the methods mentioned above, you can recover password Windows 7 at ease and no data will be lost or damaged at all. So you will not get puzzled anymore while in need of recovering Windows 7 password in the future.

The same features are included on the Windows 7 installation CD, but if you’ve lost this disc or it is damaged, you will need a repair disc to access the Windows 7 password recovery features if your system malfunctions or becomes unbootable.Click the Windows "Start" button and select "Control Panel" from the menu. Click "System and Security," then select "Backup and Restore."Click "Create a System Repair Disc." If you have more than one optical drive installed on your PC, choose your preferred CD/DVD burner from the drop-down menu. Place a blank CD or DVD in the drive tray and click "Create disc." A progress bar displays on the screen.Click "OK" when Windows reports that the process is complete. Creating the recovery disc should only take a few minutes.With the system recovery disk, you can reset windows 7 password quickly. Go Back in the Locked PC with Windows 7 adminstrator Account

Forgot Windows 7 login password? Devastating for you have a lot of important files and documents in your PC? Don’t be upset then, there are ways to get back in, and I will lead you through the steps of windows 7 login password recovery, if you forgot your password, or lost password, only if you have access to the administrator account, you can go back in.
Windows 7 has a built-in administrator account which has no password in it. This account is created during Windows installation, and disable by default. You can log in as that account to reset windows 7 login password of other accounts by doing the following steps.
Note: Through this tip you need to enable Windows 7 default Administrator account before you’ve forgotten windows 7 login password, as the default admin account is disable by default, only you enable it, will it appear in the log in screen.
Step 1: Start your computer and press "F8" while the computer boots up. The Advanced Boot Options screen appears. Scroll down to "Safe Mode with Command Prompt".
Step 2: Select the Administrator account that appear in the screen, then enter command prompt. (This is the direct way on how to reset windows 7 login password.)
Step 3: Type: net user Liz123456 and enter (Liz is the account which you need to unlock password, and 123456 is the new password) it will show you a message that “the command completed successfully”.
Step 4: Restart your computer, then you can log in as Liz with the password 123456. You can go to control Panel to change windows 7 login password if necessary.
The second tip does not promise you 100% to recover Windows 7 login password, as you may disable your Windows 7 default admin account. But the first tip can break your password with amazing rate.

How to Reset or Bypass Windows Vista Password

One of the worst things that a computer user can run into is forgetting their password. When you forgot windows vista password to your computer, you can't log in to your account or access the files on your vista system. You can bypass windows vista password, though, using the Windows Login Recovery and Windows installation disc that came with your system.
Windows Login Recovery is made to reset lost password for Windows 7/Vista/XP/2000 and Server 2003/2008, etc, which may also help you create a vista password recovery bootable disk to reset Windows vista password, and a blank CD/DVD or a USB is required. Then follow the measures:
Step 1.You need to login a PC which can link to internet and download Windows Login Recovery
Step 2.Insert a blank CD/DVD or USB flash drive, and install the program to that pc
Step 3.Run the program and burn to windows vista password reset CD/DVD OR USB flash drive
Step 4.Now, Turn to your locked PC, insert the newly create CD or USB to your drive. Reboot the Computer and then follow the instructions, it is very easy to use.
Besides, if you have windows installation disk, you can crack windows vista password with the disk as well. And here comes the guide:

Insert your Windows install disc into the optical drive on your system and turn the computer on.

Accept the license agreement when it appears on the screen.

Press the "R" button when you are asked if you would like to repair your system.

Wait for the install process to start. When the computer restarts, you will be prompted to "Press any key to continue." Don't press any key.

Watch the bottom of the screen for the "Installing Devices" prompt. Press the "Shift" key and "F10" keys together to bring up a command prompt.

Type "nusmgr.cpl" into the command prompt and press the "Enter" key on your keyboard to go into the User Accounts page.

Click on the "Administrator" account and then change windows vista password in the fields. Click "OK" and then restart the system.
</ol>
Feel down when worrying about windows vista password forgotten problems? By following the instructions and guide above, you will never worry about it at all. By using the first method of password recovery tool, you will know how to reset windows vista password in safety and in efficiency as well, and the other way will tell you how to make full use of your vista features as well. Feel Free to have a try then.

Solutions in Resetting Windows 7 Password Once Losing It

How to get password recovery Windows 7 turns into a hot topic in the internet since it is common for some people to lose windows password. To prevent the password from being lost, to create a Windows 7 password reset disk would be necessary.
Windows password reset disk allows you to reset password Windows 7 when the Windows password is lost. If you want to create a password reset disk in resetting Windows 7 passwordonce losing the Win7 password, you can follow the steps below:
1. Insert a removable media such as a USB flash drive or floppy in computer.
2. Open User Accounts and click Start -&gt; Control Panel -&gt; User Accounts and Family Safety -&gt;User Accounts
3. In the left pane, click Create a password reset disk, and then forgotten password wizard comes up.
4. Click Next and follow the forgotten windows 7 password instructions to create the password reset disk.
With the disk created, you will never worry about Windows 7 password recovery any longer. And it would be more enjoyable to use PC to share your life. However, once you forgot windows 7 password, and there is no password reset disk created, how to reset windows 7 password then? To use password recovery tools would be your best choice.

Instantly Solving Windows 7 Password Lost Problems

When you forgot Windows 7 password, one of the best ways is to create a Windows 7 password reset disk which allows you to reset password. If you want to create a password reset disk in terms of lost Windows 7 password, you can follow the below steps:
1. Insert a removable media such as a USB flash drive or floppy in computer.
2. Open User Accounts and click Start; Control Panel; User Accounts and Family Safety;User Accounts
3. In the left pane, click Create a password reset disk, and then forgotten password wizard comes up.
4. Click Next and follow the forgotten password instructions to create the windows 7 password reset disk.
Once the Windows 7 password reset disk is completed, please locate it in a safe place. It will be helpful if your Windows 7 password lost. Although it is simple to create such a simple disk, many users forget to create one. In that case, it is recommended to use some kinds of Windows password reset tool, like Windows Login Recovery, which can breezily recover Windows 7 password with a bootable CD/DVD or USB flash drive.
Besides, using the password protect system in Windows 7 helps secure your data from unauthorized users. It also enables other users to have their own profiles and login data on the same computer. If you have forgotten your password, you can reset windows 7 password as long as you have the Windows 7 installation disc.

Place the Windows 7 installation disc into the computer's CD/DVD drive.

Click the "Repair Your Computer" option. Select a language and then click "Next."

Click the "Command Prompt" and type "net user<user account>." Replace "user account" with your name. Press "Enter."

Type in a new password and press "Enter" once to save the password and one more time to confirm the choice. You can now log on to Windows 7 with your user name and new password.

In this way, you can also get windows 7 password recovery. So if you have met the problem of windows 7 password forgot, you can feel free to use the two methods above so as to gain quick and instant access to your locked System.

Windows Password Recovery Solutions if You Forgot Password

When you forgot Windows 7 password, what would you prefer to do? Take your computer to a PC repair shop or re-install it? Well, it is not the best way to reset your lost Windows 7 password actually. Don't believe it? Just have a try of the following Windows password recovery solutions if you forgot password Windows 7 to your computer.
It's well known that Windows administrator users have rights to change password of other user account on the same computer. So if you forgot password of the user account, just enter your administrator account and reset Windows 7 password as follows:
1. Press F8 to enter the Advanced Boot Options when booting your PC.
2. Select Safe Mode and enter your computer with an Administrator password.
3. In Safe Mode, click Start-> Run-> Type control userpasswords2->click OK.
4. On the coming up Users screen, click the name of the user account that you want to recover windows 7 password for, and then click Reset Password to process.
Besides, many free Windows password recovery tool are supposed to help you get back in computer if one forgot Windows 7 password for your computer. In reality, some users resort to free Windows password recovery tool to unlock windows 7 password for their PC, like Ophcrack. How to Remove Excel Password Before or After You Lost It

You would like to protect the data in an Excel workbook? If so, you can do so by setting a password for the Excel workbook. Password-protected Excel files cannot be modified without first removing their password by using the "Unprotect Sheet" option included in Excel. Once the password is removed, the document can be modified freely. If you would like others to modify the workbook, you should remove Excel password by following steps:

Launch Excel. Click on the "Open" folder icon, navigate to the file on the hard drive and double-click the file name to open it.

Type in the password that you set for the workbook and press "Enter." The workbook should open on the screen.

Click on the button with the Microsoft Office icon in the upper-left corner. Hover over "Prepare" and choose "Encrypt document" from the options that appear.

Highlight the asterisks in the "Encrypt document" box that pops up. Press "Delete" and click "OK."

Press the "Save" button at the top of the screen to save the file. Confirm that you want to write over the original file, if prompted, and the file is saved without the password.

If you forgot Excel password before you removed it, you will be locked out of the workbook and have no rights to modify or view it neither.
